Intro.title: Mees Rutten
Intro.intro: My name is Mees Rutten. I'm an aspiring Creative Front-end Developer. I want to create high performance, accessible websites that deliver amazing experiences to the user. I'm currently following Communication and Multimedia Design in Amsterdam.
Intro.imageAlt: Dutch Digital Agencies, Dutch Design Week.
Intro.imageAlt2: Presenting in the Public Library of Amsterdam.
Intro.imageAlt3: I work at MediaMonks as a Front-end Developer.
Intro.paragraph1: I'm currently focussing a lot on 2D and 3D animation with GSAP and Three.js.
Intro.listItem2: Best project of 400+ students during first year

Magic-library.title: Magic Library
Magic-library.intro: A micro library to make the Web Animations API easier to use via JSON components.
Magic-library.paragraph1: I created Magic Library to learn more about the Web Animations API. I found out that for most of my use cases in User Interface Motion Design I used the same animations. With Magic Library you can use single JSON files to animate elements. You can also use all the possibilities of the Web Animations API and change the animation inline.

Timeline-of-artists.title: Timeline of Artists
Timeline-of-artists.intro: A timeline of artists during the Golden Age of Amsterdam.
Timeline-of-artists.paragraph1: I made this project in a week and then spent another week to add serverside rendering. It was created during my Minor for the Public Library of Amsterdam
Timeline-of-artists.paragraph2: I used animations like GSAP SplitText for the titles. CSS Perspective for hover animation and a lot of fade and opacity tricks.
Timeline-of-artists.paragraph3: The clientside rendered version is currently online on my CodePen! You can find it at the bottom of this page.

Tired.title: Tired
Tired.intro: Creative coding that depicts the user falling asleep while reading.
Tired.paragraph1: I made this project for a design class I followed. I wanted to create an animated article which simulates the user falling asleep. The content isn't quite readable but that, ofcourse, is the point of this page.
Tired.paragraph2: A version of this is currently live on CodePen! Check it out at the bottom of this page.
Tired.paragraph3: I used only CSS animations for this. It features a filter with blur that increases with the 'eyes' of the user close.

Navvy.title: Navvy
Navvy.intro: A chatbot that gives you information about certain things and helps you navigate.
Navvy.paragraph1: I created Navvy for my previous portfolio. You could ask her a lot of things about me, my work and how my portfolio worked.
Navvy.paragraph2: Navvy is currently online on CodePen! Check it out at the bottom of this page.

Globe.title: Twitter Globe
Globe.intro: An animated WebGL globe which displays the location of people tweeting about the given searchword.
Globe.paragraph1: I created this project during the class Real Time Web while following the Minor Web Development in Amsterdam. It visualizes the location of people who tweet about a certain topic.
Globe.paragraph2: I use serverside rendering, the Twitter API and the Google Dataarts WebGL Globe.
